div.p: Rome City School District is excited to announce a new ThoughtExchange to gather information from our community regarding the 2020-2021 budget.
April is School Library Month and the Rome City School District (RCSD) thanks its 7 librarians and 9 library aides for all they do to keep our students engaged.

The Superintendent's blog this week thanks the amazing clerical staff of the Rome City School District, offers congratulations for our music community on being named a Best Community for Music Education once again, provides updates on health resources for students and families, a reminder about our COVID-19 information page, and our technology support contact information.
Google Classroom Cheat Sheet for Students

The Superintendent's blog this week includes several updates regarding the Coronavirus situation, information about RFA's Virtual Spirit Week, information about child care needs for essential workers, and information about technology help for those in need.
Rome Named Best Communities for Music Education
Rome once again recognized by NAMM for the 2020 Award for Best Communities for Music Education
Board of Education New Email for Community Questions
NEW! A new email address has been set up for the community to ask questions of the Board of Education. The email address is asktheBOE@romecsd.org.
City of Rome and RCSD Extends the Property Tax and School District Tax Payment Deadline

The City of Rome, NY Mayor, Jacqueline M. Izzo and Rome City School District - Rome, NY School Superintendent, Peter Blake today announced that they have extended the property tax and school district tax payment deadline from April 30, 2020 to May 29, 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
Superintendent's Blog for the Week of March 29

The Superintendent's Blog this week (March 29) discusses the concept of home learning, information for child care needs for essential workers, technology support information, some information for families from the New York State Education Department, information for mental health supports, information regarding Spring break, and a reminder about the RCSD Coronavirus information site.
Follow the link to your school for access to student resources complied by teachers while school is closed.
An important message from the Superintendent - 3.16.20
Food Service Grab and Go Program

The Rome City School District announces its participation in the COVID-19 relief food Service with a Grab & Go Program. Under this program, nutritious Breakfast & Lunches will be provided to ALL Rome City School District students free of charge at the following sites starting Thursday, March 19th, 2020 from 10:30 a.m. to 12:00 p.m.
Superintendent's Blog for the week of March 16

This week's Superintendent's blog is devoted 100% to updating everyone on the current state of affairs for the Rome City School District. Please stay tuned for updates regarding how the Coronavirus is impacting our community.

We are excited to announce (and try) a new feedback gathering platform that our district has at our disposal. ThoughtExchange is a platform for people to share and rate ideas/thoughts that are related to a specific question. The current state of affairs surrounding the Coronavirus is the perfect opportunity to gather your thoughts/concerns so that we can provide feedback.
Superintendent's Blog for the week of 3/9

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses the importance of interpretation of info, the nomination period for the OD Teen All-Stars, Strough Middle School Drama Club presentation, and info about the Oneida County Youth Bureau Teen/Adult Awards!
Informational letter to RCSD parents and families on COVID-19 (Coronavirus)
Informational letter to RCSD parents and families on COVID-19 (Coronavirus)
Rome City School District 2020-21 Proposed Budget Video and Powerpoint Presentation.
Congratulations to Rome Free Academy's top 10 for the class of 2020!
Learn about the Rome Kindergarten Program and Register you child this week!
Kindergarten Registration. Monday, March 2 through Friday, March 6

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses what NY State schools have done, and continue to do, in preparation for the Coronavirus, congratulations to Staley PE teacher Diane Penella, kindergarten registration reminder, and an update on the RFA Travel Club Meeting.
Congratulations to these Strough students who received an overall average of 100 in Mrs.Comfort's first semester Art class!
Take Advantage of Rome's Text Messaging Service
Our school utilizes the SchoolMessenger system to deliver text messages, straight to your mobile phone with important information about events, school closings, safety alerts and more.
RFA Black History Club Selling Candy Bars for Till Sign
The Black History Club promotes better relationships between students, by attempting to rid cultural barriers through education and understanding. They are selling candy bars for a cause.

The Superintendent's blog this week has some preliminary budget information, information about kindergarten registration, an RFA Travel Club announcement, information about the RFA/Rotary shoe drive, and information about a free local bullying workshop.
Strough Students Get an Eyeopener on Effects of E-Cigarette Vapor on Living Cells
On February 14th middle school students were able to see firsthand the effects of e-cigarettes as they studies cells under a microscope.
Gator Families Enjoy Art Night with Snowman/Valentine's Day Theme
On Wednesday, February 12th Gansevoort Elementary families created snowman paintings with a Valentine theme.
Family ID is opening up for Spring Sports

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses our student athlete accomplishments this season, a midwinter recess reminder, an RFA travel club announcement, a reminder about the Suitcase Art Show, and information about a free bullying prevention workshop.
RFA Hosts Collegiate A Cappella Invitational

Rome Free Academys Rhapsody Show Choir will be hosting its annual Collegiate A Cappella Invitational on Saturday, February 8 at 7:30pm in the RFA Auditorium. Groups from five colleges will be performing, along with a special guest appearance from RFAs show choir Rhapsody. Tickets are $8 at the door, or $7 in advance at the Jervis Public Library or from members of Rhapsody.

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses the school aid funding formula & proposed school aid for the year, the Rome Sweetheart Dance, an opportunity to be a Youth Ambassador, and the need for a host family for exchange students.
February 37 is National School Counseling Week 2020
School counselors provide students with academic, college/career and social/emotional development.
The Rome City School Districts Journey towards Inquiry Based Learning
The goal of introducing the Inquiry Based Learning model in the Rome City School District, is to help students develop independence and self-help skills that they will need later in life.

On Friday, January 24th, Rome Free Academy hosted the ninth annual Central New York Show Choir Festival. Groups from RFA, Waterville, Whitesboro, Westmoreland, Proctor High School, New Hartford, Holland Patent, and Frankfort-Schuyler performed.
Ridge Mills Olympic Reading Challenge Kickoff
Ridge Mills kicked off their annual reading challenge on Friday, January 17.
RFA Regents and BOCES schedule for week of 1/20
RFA held it's annual Student and Alumni Cabaret where many past and present students from the drama program perform various songs from past RFA musicals.

Rome Free Academy will present its 2020 musical Cabaret Saturday, January 11, at 7:30 p.m. in the RFA Auditorium. The performance will feature a variety of musical theater pieces by current RFA students and alumni. This year marks the twelfth annual Cabaret.

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses some of our district initiatives for the coming calendar year, RFA hockey's Face Off Against Colon Cancer game this Friday night, information about health insurance for those that may be in need, the Rising Stars program, and a STEM scholarship opportunity.
RFA Students Awarded NYS Scholarships for Academic Excellence
Nine Rome Free Academy students have been awarded New York State Scholarships for Academic Excellence and were recognized on Wednesday, December 18th at RFA.
Results of the RCSD referendum vote: Prop #1- 364 yes, 127 no; Prop#2- 365 yes, 120 no. Thank you to the Rome community for supporting our students!!
How the Role of the School Counselor has Shifted
Rome City School District counselors are an important part of our educational team and provide valuable support to our students, our teachers and our families throughout the district.
Capital Improvement Project VOTE on Wednesday, December 18

On December 18th the Rome community will vote on a $14,231,055 Capital Improvement Project that would include significant maintenance concerns at RFA (roof, flashing and general maintanence), the artificial turf and track at the stadium, an Energy Performance Contract for elementary schools.
Holiday Fun in the Rome City School District
It's the most wonderful time of the year! Check out a gallery of photos featuring holiday events throughout our district!

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses spreading care for others, a Breakfast with Santa event sponsored by the RFA Travel Club, information about becoming a mentor for our mentoring program, the JCP Holiday Window Painting Competition, and opportunities for CNY STEM scholarships for high school students.

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses the concept of being Polyanna, our scholar athlete and team awards, a Christmas in the City event, and the JCP window painting competition. Have a great week!

The Rome City School Districts Music and Arts Department held its annual faculty showcase at Rome Free Academy on November 22nd, 2019. This has been an annual event since 2015. Music and art teachers come together to present their artwork and holiday music for your entertainment.
John E. Joy Elementary School 6th graders from Ms. Guiliano's and Mrs. Robbins classes are famous! They are starring in, writing, recording, and editing their own morning announcements.
The Superintendent's blog this week discusses being thankful, a referendum update, RFA's Open Mic Night, a Christmas in the City event, and the RFA holiday window painting contest with JCP.

The Rome City School Districts Music and Arts Department are presenting their annual faculty showcase at Rome Free Academy on November 22nd 2019. This has been an annual event since 2015. Music and art teachers come together to present their artwork and holiday music for your entertainment. Admission is free and monetary donations can be made to the Rome Community Foundation. Instrument donations will also be accepted. The art gallery will be opening at 6pm and concert starting at 7pm.
RFA JROTC Holiday Gift Basket - Sunday, November 24
Rome Free Academy Air Force JROTC Holiday Gift Basket Sunday, November 24, 2019

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses the evolution of society and schools, an update on the referendum vote, information about RFA's Open Mic Night, the RCSD fine arts faculty pops concert and art gallery, the JROTC holiday basket raffle, and the JCP window painting contest.
ABC's STEM Kits Donated to Elementary Schools (K-2)

Rome City School District K-2 graders will be learning about Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (S.T.E.M.) in a hands-on way, thanks to the donation of more than 75 ABCs of S.T.E.M. kits on November 7th.
RFA Seniors Sign Letters of Intent
Congratulations to RFA seniors, Justin Hoke and Isabelle Matt who signed their National Letter of Intent on Wednesday, November 13th at RFA, alongside their coaches, family and friends.

The Superintendent's blog this week mentions some recent recognition for our community/district, a reminder about school closings, a reminder about Parent Portal and report cards, an upcoming Bellamy PBIS fundraiser, and an upcoming career information opportunity for high school students.
Vote For Your Favorite Holiday Window at JC Penney in Rome
JCPenney in Rome once again invited the Senior, Junior, Sophomore, and Freshmen classes to participate in their Holiday Window Painting Contest.

On Friday, November 1, 2019 the New York Assembly Education Chairman, Michael Benedetto, visited the Rome City School District. He was joined by our local Assemblywoman, Marianne Buttenschon, who coordinated his visit.
Building Teamwork through Breakout Box Activity
National Leader Visits Rome City School District

Randi Weingarten, President of the American Federation of Teachers (AFT), met with Rome teachers, students and families yesterday, October 31, announcing $350,000 of additional AFT support for the Rome Alliance for Educations Community Schools model.
Sixth graders in Jennifer Giachetta's Art classes at Stokes and Joy Elementary created beautiful self-portraits! For these self-portraits, sixth-graders posed for a photo shoot during class.
AFT President Randi Weingarten to Visit Rome
Randi Weingarten, President of the American Federation of Teachers (AFT) representing over 1.7 million members nationwide, will be visiting the Rome City School District on Thursday October 31, 2019.

The Superintendent's blog this week provides an update on the proposed December referendum, information on an RFA marching band breakfast, information about Strough's showing of Screenagers, the Oneida County Youth Services survey, and the local trunk or treat event. Have a great week!
October 21-25 is School Bus Safety week. Denti Elementary school participates in a Peaceful Bus program.
Strough Middle School has received a $5,000 literacy grant from the Dollar General Literacy Foundation.
Congratulations to the 53 students were inducted into the National Honor Society on October 22, 2019.
Strough National Junior Honor Society Induction
Sixty eighth grade students were inducted into the National Junior Honor Society on October 17, 2019 at Strough Middle School.
Superintendent's Blog for the Week of 14

This week's blog attempts to draw an analogy between racing a car and being part of a team, has information about a County survey, information about a local Halloween event, and a reminder about an upcoming anti-bullying seminar.

RFA hosted its 50th Annual College Night on October 9th. Nearly 80 colleges and universities were on hand to provide students and families with information on admissions, academic programming, athletics, financial aid, student life, and much more!

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses some of the vast changes in education over the years, information about an RFA PBIS fundraiser, a free bullying prevention workshop, and a parent portal reminder.
THANK YOU to Connected Community Schools and Compassion Coalition, Inc. who partnered with Yoobi to give special school supplies to EVERY student and teacher at Gansevoort and Bellamy Elementary!
RFA Marching Band Continues Winning Streak

The RFA Marching Band performed at a New York State Field Band Conference competition in Oswego, NY on September 21st. The band again took first place in its division, continuing a streak of being unbeaten in competition so far this season. The band also performed at RFA's home football games on September 20th and 27th
Teachers Awarded Monies from AFRL Sprout Grant
19 teachers from the Rome City School District have been awarded money for various projects thanks to the generosity of the Air Force Research Laboratory Information Directorate.

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses the importance of minimizing screen time, a recognition for our RFA athletes, the Genesis Celebration of Education, a foster parenting information session, and NYSPHAA Official's Day. Have a great week everyone!

The Superintendent's blog this week discusses some of the opportunities our community and schools have thanks to the Connected Community Schools initiative, an emergency preparedness training event, the RFA PBIS test drive event, and a foster parenting event. Have a great week!
Homecoming t-shirts are on sale at RFA Knight Spot! $15.00 (includes tax). Contact Mary Campbell at mcampbell@romecsd.org.
Rome native, educator and musician writes letter in support of the instrument fund.
Varano's Message: Dream BIG and Follow Your Heart
Students at Ridge Mills Elementary were treated to an inspirational performance by Tom Varano, Emotion Into Art on Wednesday, September 18th.
PER NYS IMMUNIZATION REQUIREMENTS: IF PROOF OF IMMUNIZATION HAS NOT BEEN PROVIDED, STUDENTS CAN NO LONGER ATTEND SCHOOL

On September 17, 2019, Clough held their second Male Role Model event inspired by the national idea "Dads Take Your Child to School Day". Dads and male role models joined their students at school and had a blast frosting cookies and planting together!

The Rome Free Academy Marching Band competed in its first competition of the season on Saturday, September 7th, at Jordan-Elbridge High School. The Black Knights placed first in their new division, Large School 2, after finishing last season as state champions in Large School 3. The band scored higher on Saturday than any other band in Large School 2 across the state.

The Superintendent's blog this week provides some resources about a currently hot health topic, vaping. It also contains some information about an NAACP census event, the Clinton Figure Skating Club, and an after school program at King Pin Lanes.

img.alt: Mr. Blake and Dr. Stephen Hampe

div.p: Check out this video message from the Board of Education President, Dr. Stephen Hampe, and Superintendent Peter Blake!

The Superintendent's Blog this week discusses positivity despite challenges, kindergarten learning standards resources, Parent Portal, PeachJar, 2019-2020 immunization requirements, Here Comes the Bus app, and general back to school information. Have a great week!
Bus Routes and "Here Comes The Bus" App

The blog is back! This week's blog has some routine tips for kids, information on school vaccination requirements, links to our district website for back to school information, and transportation information about a new GPS mapping software that we have available for families!
As we approach the beginning of school, please be advised the registration office currently does not have appointment openings.
The Rome City School District has been very busy this summer training teachers, preparing curriculum, and getting its facilities ready for the first day of school on Thursday, September 5th.
The Supported Learning Summer Program, housed at both RFA and Ridge Mills had a whirlwind of fun this year
Parent Portal guide to retrieving student grades.
The Rome City School Districts Early Childhood Program is pleased to announce the following changes for the upcoming 2019-2020 school year.
Explore Rome City School District Curriculum
The Rome City School District is pleased to share our Atlas Curriculum Management site with the Rome Community.
Everything you need to know about using the 'Parent Portal' - User Guide and Video Instructions

The Superintendent's Blog this week's blog discusses having dreams & Martin Luther King Jr., the regents exam week at RFA, RFA Rhapsody's Show Choir Festival this weekend, and the potential to be a host family for a foreign exchange student.

MUSIC PROGRAM
2016-19 Best Communities for Music Education

div.span:
Number of Athletes1,410Sports Programs72
Athletic Website

div.h3:
What are we?
Uniting the most important influences in a childs life school, family, and community. Nurturing students into becoming productive citizens.

div.span: We are a diverse and innovative educational community that believes through both words and actions that all students can learn and be successful.
We provide continuous academic and social growth from Pre-K to graduation to ensure that students are life-long learners, productive citizens, and members of the global economy.

div.p: We are a diverse and innovative educational community that believes through both words and actions that all students can learn and be successful. We provide continuous academic and social growth from Pre-K to graduation to ensure that students are life-long learners, productive citizens, and members of the global economy.
